filesystem

Class FileSystemObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.FileSystemObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Directory, File

    public abstract class FileSystemObject
extends Object
    An abstract class of file system objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tim Lauwers, Tim Robensyn, Robbe Van Biervliet
    Invariants:
  • Each file system object must have a valid name.
        isValidName(getName())
  • Each file system object must have a valid creation time.
        isValidCreationTime(getCreationTime())
  • Each file system object must have a valid modification time.
        canHaveAsModificationTime(getModificationTime())
  • Each file system object must have a valid parent directory.
        canHaveAsParentDirectory(getParentDirectory())

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Date creationTime
      Variable referencing the time of creation.
      private Directory dir
      Variable referencing the directory of this filesystem object
      private boolean isTerminated
      Variable registering whether this file system object is terminated
      private boolean isWritable
      Variable registering whether or not this filesystem object is writable.
      private Date modificationTime
      Variable referencing the time of the last modification, possibly null.
      private String name
      Variable referencing the name of this file system object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystemObject

        protected FileSystemObject(Directory dir,
                           String name,
                           boolean writable)
        Initialize a new file system object with given directory, name and writability.
        Parameters:
        dir - The parent directory of the new file system object.
        name - The name of the new file system object.
        writable - The writability of the new file system object.
        Postconditions:
      • The new creation time of this file is initialized to some time during constructor execution.
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() >= System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() <= (new System).currentTimeMillis())
      • The new file has no time of last modification.
            new.getModificationTime() == null
        • Effects:
      • The name of the file system object is set to the given name. If the given name is not valid, a default name is set.
            setName(name)
      • The writability of the new file system object is set to the given flag.
            setWritable(writable)

      • FileSystemObject

        protected FileSystemObject(String name,
                           boolean writable)
        Initialize a new root file system object with given name and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file system object.
        writable - The writability of the new file system object.
        Effect:
        The new file system object is initialized with the given name and writability and no parent directory.
            this(null,name,writable)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        @Raw
 @Basic
public String getName()
        Return the name of this file system object.

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(String name)
        Check whether the given name is a legal name for a file system object.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the given string is effective, not empty and consisting only of letters, digits, dots, hyphens and underscores; false otherwise.
            result ==
             (name != null) && name.matches("[a-zA-Z_0-9.-]+")

      • setName

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this filesystem object to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this file system object.
        Postcondition:
        If the given name is valid, the name of this file system object is set to the given name, otherwise the name of the file system object is set to a valid name (the default).
            if (isValidName(name))
                 then new.getName().equals(name)
                 else new.getName().equals(getDefaultName())

      • getDefaultName

        @Model
private static String getDefaultName()
        Return the name for a new file system object which is to be used when the given name is not valid.
        Returns:
        A valid file system object name.
            isValidName(result)

      • changeName

        public void changeName(String name)
                throws IllegalStateException,
                       ObjectNotWritableException
        Change the name of this filesystem object to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this file system object.
        Effects:
      • The name of this file system object is set to the given name, if this is a valid name, not equal to the former name (ignoring case) the file system object is writable, its parent directory has no other file system object with the same name (ignoring case) and the file system object is a root or its parent directory is writable, otherwise there is no change.
            if ( isValidName(name) && isWritable()
              && !getParentDirectory().exists(name) && !name.equalsIgnoreCase(getName()
              && (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable()) )
            then setName(name)
      • If the new name is valid, not equal to the former name (ignoring case) the file system object is writable, its parent directory has no other file system object with the same name (ignoring case) and the file system object is a root or its parent directory is writable, the modification time of this file system object is updated.
            if ( isValidName(name) && isWritable()
              && !getParentDirectory().exists(name) && !name.equalsIgnoreCase(getName()
              && (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable()) )
            then setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        IllegalStateException - This file systemobject is terminated. | isTerminated()
        ObjectNotWritableException(this) - This file system object is not writable. | !isWritable()
        ObjectNotWritableException

      • isLexicographicallyBefore

        public boolean isLexicographicallyBefore(FileSystemObject obj)
        Check whether this file system object is ordered before this file system object, lexographically by name, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        obj - The file system object to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the other object is effective, has a valid name and the name of this item is lexicographically ordered before the name of the other object. False otherwise.
            result == (obj != null)
                     && isValidName(obj.getName())
                     && (getName().compareToIgnoreCase(obj.getName()) < 0)

      • isLexicographicallyAfter

        public boolean isLexicographicallyAfter(@Raw
                                        FileSystemObject obj)
        Check whether this file system object is ordered after this file system object, lexographically by name, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        obj - The file system object to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the other object is effective, has a valid name and the name of this item is lexicographically ordered after the name of the other object. False otherwise.
            result == (obj != null)
                     && isValidName(obj.getName())
                     && (getName().compareToIgnoreCase(obj.getName()) > 0)

      • getCreationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
 @Immutable
public Date getCreationTime()
        Return the time at which this file system object was created.

      • isValidCreationTime

        public static boolean isValidCreationTime(Date date)
        Check whether the given date is a valid creation time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is effective and not in the future.
            result ==
             (date != null) &&
             (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())

      • getModificationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
public Date getModificationTime()
        Return the time at which this file system object was last modified, that is at which the name or size was last changed. If this file system object has not yet been modified after construction, null is returned.

      • canHaveAsModificationTime

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsModificationTime(Date date)
        Check whether this file system object can have the given date as modification time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is either not effective or if the given date lies between the creation time and the current time.
            result == (date == null) ||
            ( (date.getTime() >= getCreationTime().getTime()) &&
              (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())     )

      • setModificationTime

        @Model
protected void setModificationTime()
        Set the modification time of this file to the current time.
        Postconditions:
      • The new modification time is effective.
            new.getModificationTime() != null
      • The new modification time lies between the system time at the beginning of this method execution and the system time at the end of method execution.
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() >=
                               System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() <=
                               (new System).currentTimeMillis())

      • hasOverlappingUsePeriod

        public boolean hasOverlappingUsePeriod(FileSystemObject other)
        Return whether this filesystem object and the given other filesystem object have an overlapping use period.
        Parameters:
        other - The other filesystem object to compare with.
        Returns:
        False if the other file is not effective False if the prime object does not have a modification time False if the other file is effective, but does not have a modification time otherwise, true if and only if the open time intervals of this file and the other file overlap
            if (other == null) then result == false else
            if ((getModificationTime() == null)||
                  other.getModificationTime() == null)
               then result == false
               else
            result ==
            ! (getCreationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) &&
              getModificationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) ) &&
            ! (other.getCreationTime().before(getCreationTime()) &&
              other.getModificationTime().before(getCreationTime()) )

      • isWritable

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean isWritable()
        Check whether this filesystem object is writable.

      • setWritable

        @Raw
public void setWritable(boolean isWritable)
        Set the writability of this filesystem object to the given writability.
        Parameters:
        isWritable - The new writability
        Postcondition:
        The given writability is registered as the new writability for this file.
            new.isWritable() == isWritable

      • getParentDirectory

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Directory getParentDirectory()
        Return the directory this filesystem object belongs to

      • canHaveAsParentDirectory

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsParentDirectory(Directory dir)
        Check whether this file system object can have this directory as its parent directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given directory is null and this file system object is a root object, or if the given directory has this file system object as a content item and it can have this file system object as a content item at the position it is at.
            result == ( (dir==null && isRoot())
                     || (dir.canHaveAsItemAt(this,dir.getIndexOf(this))
                        && dir.hasAsItem(this)) )

      • setParentDirectory

        @Raw
private void setParentDirectory(Directory dir)
        Set the directory of this filesystem object to the given directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - The new directory
        Effect:
        This file system object gets added to the given directory
            dir.addAsItem(this)

      • makeRoot

        public void makeRoot()
        Makes this file system object a root object.
        Effects:
      • If this file system object is not a root, it is removed from it's old parent directory.
            if (!isRoot())
              then getParentDirectory().removeAsItem(this)
      • If this file system object is not a root, its parent directory is set to null.
            if (!isRoot())
              then setParentDirectory(null)
      • If this file system object is not a root, its modification time is updated.
            if (!isRoot())
              then setModificationTime()
        • Note:
        Possible errors are caught by underlying methods.

      • move

        public void move(Directory destination)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Move a file system object to a given destination directory.
        Parameters:
        destination - The given directory
        Effects:
      • If this file system object is not a root, it is removed from the old parent directory.
            if (!isRoot())
              then getParentDirectory().removeAsItem(this)
      • The parent directory of this file system object is set to the given destination directory
            setParentDirectory(destination)
      • The modification time of this file system object is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given destination cannot contain this file system object, the destination is null or the given destination is equal to the current parent directory. | ( !destination.canHaveAsItem(this) | || destination==null | || destination==getParentDirectory() )
        Note:
        Other errors, such as those occurring because of termination/writability, are caught by the used underlying methods.

      • getRoot

        public FileSystemObject getRoot()
        Return the root of this file system object
        Returns:
        The file system object that is the root of this object

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Check whether this file system object is a root object.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether this file system object is a root object or not.

      • isTerminated

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isTerminated()
        Check whether this file system object is terminated

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws IllegalStateException
        Terminate this file system object.
        Postcondition:
        If this file system object is not yet terminated, it will be.
            if !isTerminated()
              then this.isTerminated = true
        Effect:
        If this file system object is not yet terminated and it is not a root, it becomes a root object.
            if !isTerminated() && !isRoot()
              then makeRoot()
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The file system object is not yet terminated and it is not writable or is no root or its parent directory is not writable. | !isTerminated() && | ( !isWritable() || | ! (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable()) )
